Name: AnyDesk
Description: AnyDesk is a popular remote desktop software that enables users to access and control a computer or device from a remote location. It was developed with the primary goal of facilitating remote work, technical support, and collaboration between individuals and teams.
Author: Ali Alwashali, Nasreddine Bencherchali

Disk.Description: AnyDesk service log file. As well as ad.trace, we can determine the IP address of the other participant and its AnyDesk ID when a connection is established.

Incoming connection logs, contains IP Address of the remote machine and file transfer activity. Only generated on target side. The content indicates how the connection was approved (e.g. the local user authorized it, or a password was used)

Incoming connection logs, contains IP Address of the remote machine and file transfer activity. Only generated on target side. The content indicates how the connection was approved (e.g. the local user authorized it, or a password was used)

AnyDesk user interface log file. In this log file, we can determine the IP address of the other participant and its AnyDesk ID. It is also possible to track events of file transfer. Below is the Client ID and external IP address of the remote participant.
Example: info 2022-09-28 12:39:26.845       lsvc   9952   9944   21                anynet.any_socket - Logged in from 12.xx.xx.21:59562 on relay 80e496c0.

Disk.Description: If the chat functionality is used, its entries will be printed in a text file in this folder.
Password can be set to auto-validate the session. The password will be saved in a salted hash format.

EventLog.Description: Service installation event as result of AnyDesk installation.

Network.Description: During setup the boot.net.anydesk.com domain is request over port 443

Detections.Description: Anydesk Remote Access Software Service Installation
Remote Access Tool - AnyDesk Silent Installation

Name: Action1
Description:
Action1 is a powerful Remote Monitoring and Management(RMM) tool that enables users to execute commands, scripts, and binaries. 
Through the web interface of action1, the administrator must create a new policy or an app to establish remote execution and then points that the agent is installed.
Author: @kostastsale

Details.Verification: Corporate email required although temporary email services are accepted

Disk.Description: Multiple files and binaries related to Action1 installation
Multiple scripts related to Action1 installation
Contains history, errors, system notifications. Incoming and outgoing connections.

EventLog.Description: Service installation event as result of Action1 installation.
Service installation event as result of Action1 installation.
Executing command to get logged on user.

Registry.Description: Service installation event as result of Action1 installation.
Ensures that detailed crash information is available for analysis, which aids in maintaining the stability and reliability of the software.
Storing its configuration settings and other relevant information

Detections.Name: Arbitrary code execution and remote sessions via Action1 RMM
Detections.Description: Threat hunting rule for detecting the execution of arbitrary code and remote sessions via Action1 RMM
Detections.author: @kostastsale
